zh.title: 美国 45Q 碳氧化物封存税收抵免 (IRA 2022 增强版)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

美国 45Q 碳氧化物封存税收抵免是目前全球最成熟且最具影响力的 CCUS 激励机制之一。在 2022 年《通胀削减法案》(IRA) 的大幅增强下，该政策从根本上重塑了碳管理产业的经济性。核心变革包括：首先，大幅上调抵免额度，将常规工业设施和电力项目的地质封存抵免额从每吨 $50 提升至 **$85**，将直接空气捕集 (DAC) 的抵免额从 $50 跃升至 **$180**；其次，引入了“直接支付 (Direct Pay)”和“额度转让 (Transferability)”机制，允许非营利组织、政府机构乃至普通纳税实体能够通过现金方式提前变现税收资产，极大地缓解了 CCUS 项目的高初期资本压力。

此外，该法案将项目开工期限延长至 **2033 年**，为长期资本规划提供了十年以上的确定性窗口。为了促进社会公平和高质量就业，法案还规定，只有满足“现行工资 (Prevailing Wage)”和“学徒制”要求的项目才能获得上述全额抵免，否则其基本抵免率将下调 80%。这一机制不仅是降碳工具，更是美国能源独立与制造业升级的国家战略引擎。

en.title: Section 45Q Tax Credit for Carbon Oxide Sequestration (IRA 2022 Enhanced)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The US 45Q tax credit, enhanced by the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) of 2022, is a global benchmark for CCUS incentives. Key enhancements include increasing the credit value to **$85/t** for industrial and power facilities and **$180/t** for Direct Air Capture (DAC). The IRA introduced revolutionary 'Direct Pay' and 'Transferability' mechanisms, allowing tax-exempt entities and developers to monetize credits directly, significantly improving project bankability.

Furthermore, the legislation extended the construction start deadline to **2033**, providing a stable decade-long investment window. To promote high-quality domestic jobs, the full credit rates are tied to 'Prevailing Wage' and apprenticeship standards. If these are not met, the credit is reduced by 80%. This policy acts not only as a decarbonization tool but as a national strategic engine for US energy independence and industrial modernization.

zh.title: 欧盟净零工业法案 (Net-Zero Industry Act - NZIA)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

《净零工业法案》(NZIA) 是欧盟绿色新政的核心支柱，旨在确保欧盟在清洁技术领域的全球竞争力和能源主权。对于 CCUS 领域，NZIA 具有里程碑意义，它首次通过立法的形式确立了 **2030 年欧盟全境每年至少 5000 万吨（50 Mtpa）二氧化碳注入能力** 的强制性目标。

该法案最引人注目的条款是建立了 **“石油和天然气生产商责任制”**。根据法案，凡是在欧盟境内从事原油和天然气生产的实体，必须按其 2020-2023 年产量的市场份额比例，强制性地为上述 50 Mtpa 的封存目标贡献额度。这一机制将 CCS 设施的建设责任从政府直接压实到了化石能源巨头身上。NZIA 还确立了‘净零战略项目’地位，为符合条件的 CCS 枢纽提供极速许可流程、优先融资准入以及跨境监管协调。通过这种‘硬指标+硬责任’的法律构造，欧盟旨在打破 CCS 产业长期存在的‘捕集有余、封存不足’的结构性瓶颈。
zh.interpretation: NZIA 是欧盟首个将二氧化碳封存能力转化为‘法律义务’的法案，强制要求石油和天然气生产商承担减排责任。

impactAnalysis.economic: 强制压实油气巨头的封存建设责任，实现了从单纯‘污染付费’向‘负责基建’的转型，极大地解决了封存端因 CAPEX 高昂导致的投资滞后问题。
impactAnalysis.technical: 战略性地推动了全欧洲范围内地质封存场的大规模详查与确权，加速了跨国二氧化碳运输网络的技术互通与标准一致性。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 确立了全球首个主权级的硬性封存容量指标（50 Mtpa），为欧盟实现 2050 碳中和愿景提供了具备法律约束力的物理底座。

en.title: EU Net-Zero Industry Act (NZIA)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The Net-Zero Industry Act (NZIA), which entered into force in June 2024, is the legislative backbone of the EU’s strategy to scale up the manufacturing of clean technologies. For the CCS sector, it introduces a groundbreaking mandate: **a Union-wide objective to reach an annual injection capacity of at least 50 million tonnes of CO2 by 2030**. 

Central to achieving this goal is the **individual contribution obligation for oil and gas producers**. Companies producing crude oil and natural gas in the EU are legally required to contribute to this 50 Mtpa storage target pro rata to their share of production between 2020 and 2023. By holding emitters responsible for building the necessary infrastructure, the EU aims to eliminate the 'chicken-and-egg' dilemma that has long stalled sequestration projects. Furthermore, CCS Hubs designated as 'Net-Zero Strategic Projects' benefit from accelerated permitting, synchronized cross-border regulatory frameworks, and prioritized access to EU and national funding, solidifying CCS as a pillar of European industrial autonomy.
en.interpretation: The NZIA is the first EU legislation to turn CO2 storage capacity into a 'legal obligation', mandating O&G producers to contribute to regional goals.

impactAnalysis.technical: Triggers a massive European-wide characterization of geological storage sites and accelerates the standardization of cross-border CO2 transport protocols.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Establishes the world’s first legally binding sovereign storage target (50 Mtpa), providing the physical foundation necessary for the EU to remain on track for climate neutrality by 2050.

## 政策概览

中国国家 CCUS 标准体系（涵盖 GB/T 41331 等系列标准）是中国规范碳捕集、利用与封存全产业链技术要求的核心准则。近年来，中国加快了 CCUS 国家标准的制定与修订工作，重点覆盖了二氧化碳捕集能效、管道运输安全、咸水层封存监测及碳利用产品的环境评价等关键环节。这些标准不仅为中国百万吨级 CCUS 示范工程提供了技术合规手册，更通过对齐 ISO 国际标准，推动了中国 CCUS 技术与装备的“走出去”战略。通过确立严谨的技术红线，国家标准体系有效地降低了项目的操作风险，为碳市场核算提供了公认的量化基础。

zh.title: 中国人民银行碳减排支持工具 (CERF)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

中国人民银行（央行）推出的‘碳减排支持工具（CERF）’是支持中国 CCUS 技术融资的基石性货币政策工具。该工具采取‘先贷后借’的直达机制：金融机构（含全国性银行及部分外资行）先向 CCUS 等重点减排领域企业发放贷款，随后可向央行申请资金支持。央行按贷款本金的 **60%** 提供资金，利率极具竞争力（2026年最新下调至 **1.25%**）。

该政策在 2024 年后经历了重要升级：首先，实施期限已正式延长至 **2027 年末**，为 CCUS 项目的长期融资提供了可预期的资金窗口；其次，支持范围从单纯的捕集扩展到了节能降碳全产业链。截至 2024 年中，该工具已带动年度碳减排量近 2 亿吨。对于资金密集型的 CCUS 项目，CERF 通过大幅降低商业银行的资金成本，间接引导了万亿级绿色信贷流向低碳技术领域，是支撑中国‘双碳’目标实现的核心经济杠杆。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 1.25% 的超低再贷款利率，将 CCUS 项目的融资成本压低至市场平均水平以下，显著提升了大规模碳捕集项目的财务稳健性。
impactAnalysis.technical: 引导金融资源流向具有显著直接减排效应的技术路径，推动了火电、化工等传统高碳行业向 CCUS 深度集成的技术转型。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为‘双碳’金融政策的核心，已带动年度近 2 亿吨的减排潜力，是实现绿色金融支撑实体经济减排的关键路径。

en.title: China Carbon Emission Reduction Facility (CERF)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The Carbon Emission Reduction Facility (CERF), launched by the People's Bank of China (PBOC), is the financial cornerstone for CCUS deployment in China. Operating on a 'lead-loan-then-refinance' mechanism, the PBOC provides 60% of the principal for loans issued by qualifying financial institutions to key decarbonization sectors, including CCUS. The interest rate for this facility was recently reduced to an ultra-competitive **1.25%** in early 2026.

Crucially, the implementation period has been extended to **the end of 2027**, providing a multi-year window of financial predictability for capital-intensive carbon management infrastructure. By mid-2024, CERF had mobilized over 1.1 trillion CNY in green loans, contributing to an annual reduction of nearly 200 million tonnes of CO2. For CCUS developers, this policy effectively bridges the financing gap by leveraging central bank capital to lower commercial borrowing costs, driving the industrialization of carbon capture technologies.

impactAnalysis.technical: Prioritizes high-impact decarbonization pathways, accelerating the adoption of integrated capture solutions in the power and chemicals sectors.
impactAnalysis.environmental: A key financial driver for China's Dual-Carbon goals, mobilizing over a trillion CNY to support projects delivering direct and verifiable GHG reductions.

## 政策概览

欧盟碳边境调节机制 (CBAM) 是全球首个针对高碳进口产品征收“碳关税”的政策工具。虽然 CBAM 的核心是防止碳泄漏，但它对全球 CCUS 产业具有深远的倒逼效应。根据 2024 年的最新实施细则，欧盟正在研究如何在其碳核算体系中正式承认出口国生产工艺中的 CCUS 减排贡献。如果生产商能够证明其通过 CCUS 降低了产品的嵌入排放强度，则可相应减少 CBAM 凭证的购买义务。这一政策直接驱动了中国、印度及东南亚等贸易伙伴国在其出口导向型行业（如钢铁、水泥）中加速部署 CCUS 技术，以维护其在全球低碳贸易中的竞争力。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过对进口高碳产品（钢铁、水泥等）征收碳关税，平衡了欧盟境内企业应用 CCUS 的高昂成本，创造了低碳产品的国际贸易溢价。
impactAnalysis.technical: 2024 年过渡期规则强制要求核算‘实际隐含排放’，这意味着在生产端集成 CCUS 技术的进口商可直接通过降低碳成本获得竞争优势。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为防止碳泄漏的全球首创工具，倒逼欧盟贸易伙伴加速其工业设施的 CCUS 升级，实现全球范围内的减排协同。

zh.title: 挪威海底二氧化碳运输与存储规例
zh.description:
## 政策概览

挪威的 CO2 存储法律框架主要由 2014 年颁布并于 2020 年更新的第 1517 号规例（Regulation No. 1517）构成。该规例基于欧盟《CCS 指令》并深度融合了挪威成熟的石油立法，为在挪威大陆架进行海底二氧化碳储存提供了坚实的法律基础。其核心确立了挪威政府对所有海底储层的绝对所有权，并引入了包含勘探、开发与运营在内的严谨许可制度。

该框架最显著的特点是其**长期责任转移机制**。规定在封存作业停止后，经过一段监管期（通常为关闭后至少 20 年）且证明储层物理稳定性后，相关的长期监测和安全责任可正式移交给挪威中央政府。这一条款极大地降低了 Northern Lights 等商业运营商的无限期法律风险。此外，2020 年的更新强化了职业健康与环境安全标准，确保了挪威在离岸 CCS 全球标准中的领导地位。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过确立封存结束后的责任移交节点，显著降低了项目的风险资本计提和长期保险成本，使海底封存成为可银行融资的商业化业务。
impactAnalysis.technical: 设定了北海最高等级的储层监测与完整性核证标准，推动了海底地震监测、卫星遥感等技术在 CCS 领域的标准化应用。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为欧洲离岸封存的‘安全锚点’，确保了跨国运至挪威的二氧化碳能实现永久性地质隔离，维护了减排额度的诚信度。

implementationDetails.mechanism: 勘探与运营许可制度 (Licensing) 与 长期责任移交 (Liability Transfer)

en.title: Norway CO2 Storage & Transport Regulations (Offshore)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Norway’s legal framework for carbon storage is anchored in Regulation No. 1517, originally established in 2014 and updated in 2020. Built upon the EU CCS Directive and integrated with Norwegian petroleum law, it provides the definitive regulatory structure for offshore storage on the Norwegian Continental Shelf (NCS). The regulation asserts state ownership over all subsea reservoirs and mandates a rigorous permitting system for exploration, development, and operation.

A key pillar of this framework is the **Liability Transfer Mechanism**, which allows commercial operators to transfer long-term monitoring and remediation responsibilities to the Norwegian state after a defined monitoring period post-closure. This provision effectively caps the tail-risk for developers like Northern Lights. The 2020 updates further refined environmental and safety standards, ensuring Norway remains the global leader in offshore CCS technical regulation.

impactAnalysis.economic: Dramatically reduces long-term risk premiums and insurance costs for project developers by providing a clear exit path for legal liability.
impactAnalysis.technical: Sets global benchmarks for subsea reservoir monitoring and integrity verification, driving innovation in 4D seismic and plume modeling technologies.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Ensures the highest fidelity for permanent geological isolation of European industrial CO2, maintaining the integrity of the broader EU carbon market.

zh.title: 加拿大 CCUS 投资税务抵免 (ITC)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

加拿大 CCUS 投资税收抵免 (CCUS ITC) 是加拿大联邦政府为对冲美国 45Q 政策竞争而推出的核心激励工具。该政策为符合条件的 CCUS 资本支出提供最高 50% 至 60% 的税收抵免（其中大气直接捕集项目抵免比例最高）。与传统的财政补贴不同，ITC 通过直接抵减企业应纳税额，显著改善了大型捕集设施（如油砂矿和化肥厂）的初期现金流。为了确保环境保真度，加拿大法律要求享受抵免的项目必须通过严格的 MRV 审核，且明确排除了将捕集的二氧化碳用于提高石油采收率 (EOR) 的项目获得抵免的资格，体现了加拿大推动永久地质封存的政策导向。

impactAnalysis.economic: 提供高达 50%-60% 的可退还税收抵免，显著降低项目资本开支 (CAPEX)，并允许与省级补贴（如阿尔伯塔省 ACCIP）叠加。
impactAnalysis.technical: 通过阶梯式抵免率显式激励直接空气捕集 (DAC, 60%) 与盐水层封存，体现了对高价值脱碳路径的技术偏好。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为加拿大 2030 减排计划的经济引擎，支撑油砂、钢铁、水泥等重工业的深度脱碳。

implementationDetails.fundingScale: 预计 2030 年前投入约 124 亿加元

zh.title: 英国 CCUS 产业愿景 (CCUS Vision)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

英国《CCUS 愿景》(CCUS Vision) 于 2023 年 12 月发布，确立了英国到 2035 年建立全球领先、具有竞争力的 CCUS 市场的战略蓝图。该政策支柱是英国政府承诺的 200 亿英镑 专项资金，旨在通过“集群化”开发模式，到 2030 年建成四个工业捕集集群（如 HyNet 和东海岸集群），实现每年 2000 万至 3000 万吨的封存能力。该愿景标志着英国从政府主导的早期开发阶段向商业化、市场化运作的长期转型。

impactAnalysis.economic: 承诺 25 年内投入 217 亿英镑，通过 DPA 和 ICC 等差价合约模型，为投资者提供长期收入保障，显著降低项目融资成本。
impactAnalysis.technical: 通过‘集群测序’模式，集中资源攻克 HyNet 和 East Coast 等先锋集群的大规模捕集与跨境封存技术难题。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 目标到 2030 年每年封存 2000-3000 万吨 CO2，支撑英国 2050 净零排放目标的实现。

zh.title: 澳大利亚保障机制 (Safeguard Mechanism) 2023 修订版
zh.description:
## 政策概览

澳大利亚保障机制 (Safeguard Mechanism) 在 2023 年进行了重大改革，将其从一个单纯的排放基准机制转型为驱动工业脱碳的强制性约束工具。改革后的机制要求澳大利亚最大的 215 家工业设施每年的排放强度必须强制降低 4.9%。这一政策为 CCUS 技术在澳大利亚液化天然气 (LNG) 和采矿业的大规模应用创造了强烈的市场需求。法律允许企业通过部署 CCUS 或购买“保障机制信贷 (SMCs)”来履行合规义务，极大提升了诸如桑托斯 (Santos) 姆巴 (Moomba) 等大型 CCS 枢纽项目的商业吸引力，是澳大利亚实现 2050 净零排放的关键支柱。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过每年 4.9% 的基准线递减率，强制推高高排放设施的碳成本，并将 CCS 转化为具备经济竞争力的合规工具。
impactAnalysis.technical: 强制要求所有新建 LNG 项目实现 100% 伴生 CO2 减排，直接锁定了大规模离岸/在岸封存技术路径的刚需。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为澳洲 2030 减排 43% 目标的核心引擎，覆盖超过 200 家大型工业设施，占全国总排放的 28%。

implementationDetails.mechanism: 基准线递减与信贷交易 (Baselines & Credit Units)
implementationDetails.fundingScale: 市场化交易（涉及数十亿澳元碳信贷流动）

market.label: 4.9% Annual Decline
market.evidence: 确立了强制递减基准线，并引入 SMCs 专用信贷交易体系。

zh.title: 印尼 2024 年第 14 号总统令 (CCS 框架)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

印度尼西亚 2024 年第 14 号总统令（PR 14/2024）于 2024 年 1 月 30 日生效，标志着印尼正式建立了东南亚首个针对碳捕集与封存（CCS）的全面法律框架。该法规不仅旨在填补此前的监管真空，更将印尼定位为区域性的碳管理中心。核心机制包括两大运营模式：首先是在现有的石油和天然气特许经营区（Working Areas）内由承包商开展 CCS，这通常通过修订原有的分成合同实现；其次是建立独立的‘碳存储许可区 (WIPK)’，允许专门的实体申请勘探和运营许可。

PR 14/2024 最具战略意义的创新是其**跨境封存条款**。法规明确允许印尼境内 CCS 运营商分配最多 30% 的存储容量给来自国外的二氧化碳，前提是外国实体在印尼有投资背景，且双方国家已签署双边协议。此外，该令还确立了政府特许权使用费、税收与非税激励机制，并明确了由能源与矿产资源部 (MEMR) 及 SKK Migas 构成的多级审批体系。这一法案为 BP 旗下的 Tangguh 等重大 CCS 枢纽的商业化运作奠定了法律基石。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 30% 的跨境封存配额，印尼旨在通过‘服务费’模式吸收新加坡等区域邻国的减排资本，为国内大规模基础设施建设提供直接资金支撑。
impactAnalysis.technical: 重点聚焦于枯竭油气田的大规模安全回注与监测，推动了印尼上游产业的技术升级与 CCUS 商业闭环试点。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为印尼 2060 碳中和路径的关键法制支柱，旨在每年抵消数千万吨的工业二氧化碳排放。

en.title: Indonesia Presidential Regulation No. 14/2024 (CCS Framework)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Enacted on January 30, 2024, Indonesia’s Presidential Regulation No. 14 of 2024 (PR 14/2024) provides the first comprehensive legal architecture for Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) in Southeast Asia. Designed to turn Indonesia into a premier carbon management hub, the regulation establishes two primary operating models: CCS within existing upstream Oil & Gas Working Areas (conducted by PSC contractors via contract amendments) and independent Carbon Storage Permit Areas (WIPK) for specialized entities.

The decree’s most significant breakthrough is its **Cross-border Storage provisions**, allowing CCS operators to allocate up to 30% of their storage capacity for CO2 captured outside Indonesia. This is contingent on bilateral agreements and local investment by the foreign entities. PR 14/2024 also formalizes government royalties, tax and non-tax incentives, and a multi-tiered approval process led by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (MEMR) and SKK Migas, providing the legal certainty required for major projects like the Tangguh hub to proceed.

impactAnalysis.economic: By enabling a 30% cross-border cap, Indonesia aims to absorb regional decarbonization capital (e.g., from Singapore) via a service-fee model to offset massive infrastructure costs.
impactAnalysis.technical: Prioritizes large-scale injection in depleted reservoirs, accelerating the technical pivot of Indonesia's oil and gas sector towards carbon management engineering.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Legal backbone for Indonesia’s 2060 Net Zero ambition, designed to enable the mitigation of tens of millions of tonnes from the industrial and power sectors annually.

zh.description:
## 政策概览

日本于 2024 年 5 月正式颁布了《二氧化碳存储业务法》（CCS 事业法），这是日本实现 2030 年 CCS 商业化目标的核心法律基石。该法案确立了全球领先的许可与确权制度，允许专业运营商在指定的咸水层区域获得排他性的封存权。法案最显著的特征是引入了“无过错责任”原则，明确了运营商在钻探与封存活动中的损害赔偿义务，同时建立了向日本能源和金属矿物资源机构 (JOGMEC) 转移长期责任的法律路径。这一立法不仅支撑了苫小牧等示范项目的扩大，也为日本企业参与“亚洲 CCUS 网络”提供了制度保障。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过将存储许可确立为具有排他性的‘准物权’，大幅提升了 CCS 项目的融资抵押能力，解决了长期投资的法律不确定性。
impactAnalysis.technical: 确立了极高标准的监测与安全规范，特别是针对地震带特征的压力监控，提升了社会对 CCS 技术的安全性信任。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为日本 GX 战略的法制保障，支撑实现 2030 年最高 1200 万吨的年度封存量目标。

zh.description:
## 政策概览

丹麦的 CCUS 基金与负排放差价合约 (NECCS) 是全球首个专门针对生物质碳捕集与封存 (BECCS) 的大规模竞争性招标机制。该计划由丹麦能源署 (ENS) 管理，通过为期 20 年的长期合约补偿项目捕集与封存每吨二氧化碳的成本缺口。2024 年，丹麦政府大幅增加了该基金的预算，累计投入达 287 亿丹麦克朗，旨在到 2030 年实现每年 230 万吨至 320 万吨的额外减排。这一机制不仅支持了 Orsted 等能源巨头的 CCUS 转型，也通过与挪威北极光项目的跨境协作，确立了丹麦作为北欧碳管理枢纽的关键地位。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 NECCS 基金提供约 1000 DKK/t 的高额补贴，并配合 20 年长期的差价合约 (CCfD) 机制，解决了 BECCS 项目的高运营成本难题。
impactAnalysis.technical: 驱动了‘Ørsted Kalundborg’多点捕集枢纽的建设，实现了生物质碳捕集与跨境（至挪威）封存的技术集成方案。

zh.title: 韩国二氧化碳捕集、运输、存储与利用法 (CCUS 法)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

韩国《CCUS 法案》于 2024 年 2 月正式颁布，并计划于 2025 年 2 月全面施行。这是韩国首部整合了捕集、运输、存储和利用全产业链的专项法律，解决了此前各部委职责交叉、监管碎片化的痛点。该法案的核心突破之一是明确将捕集的 CO2 及其衍生产品（非废弃副产品）排除在《废弃物管理法》之外，从而在法律上扫清了跨境碳贸易和资源化利用的障碍。

此外，该法案引入了极具特色的**“产业集群指定制度 (Cluster Designation System)”**。地方政府可以提交集群开发计划，获批后将由中央政府提供财政补贴、行政提速及公共土地租金减免。这一制度旨在通过规模效应降低基础设施成本，支撑韩国实现 2050 碳中和目标。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过中央政府对‘CCUS 产业集群’的直接财政补贴和公共土地租金减免，大幅降低了能源密集型企业应用 CCUS 技术的资本支出压力。
impactAnalysis.technical: 法律通过界定非废弃物属性，显式支持 CCU（碳利用）技术路径的商业化，包括将 CO2 转化为合成燃料或其他工业原料。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为韩国实现 2050 碳中和愿景的关键法制保障，旨在支撑每年千万吨级的工业减排量并促进区域性跨国封存合作。

implementationDetails.mechanism: 集群指定制度 (Cluster Designation) 与 财政补助

en.title: South Korea Act on CO2 Capture, Transport, Storage, and Utilization (CCUS Act)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Promulgated in February 2024 and effective from February 2025, South Korea’s CCUS Act is a landmark piece of legislation that unifies the regulation of the entire value chain. By integrating fragmented rules previously managed by different ministries, the Act provides a stable legal foundation for industrialization. A key highlight is the legal classification of captured CO2 and its derivatives as non-waste, exempting them from restrictive waste management laws and facilitating cross-border carbon trade.

The Act also introduces a **Cluster Designation System**, where local governments can propose industrial hubs to receive central government subsidies, administrative fast-tracking, and public land rent exemptions. This approach leverages economies of scale to accelerate the deployment of CCUS infrastructure necessary for South Korea's 2050 Net Zero goal.

impactAnalysis.technical: Explicitly fosters the CCU (Carbon Utilization) market by providing a clear legal framework for turning CO2 into high-value synthetic products and minerals.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Legal backbone for South Korea's 2050 climate commitment, designed to facilitate multi-million tonne annual reductions and regional carbon storage partnerships.

zh.description:
## 政策概览

ISO/TC 265 是负责制定 CCUS 领域全球统一标准的技术委员会。其发布的核心标准矩阵构成了全球 CCUS 项目合规性与技术保真度的基石。核心标准包括：**ISO 27914**（专门用于地质封存的安全与风险管理）、**ISO 27916**（针对 CO2-EOR 关联封存的量化与核证）以及正在不断完善的 **ISO 27919**（捕集性能评估）。

2024-2025 年间，ISO/TC 265 进一步扩展了技术边界，发布了 **ISO/TR 27926:2024**（重点解决从 EOR 向纯封存转型的技术路径）和 **ISO/TR 27929:2024**（规范了日益增长的船运 CO2 运输安全）。这些国际标准不仅为跨国 CCUS 合作（如欧洲与东南亚的跨境封存枢纽）提供了通用语言，还直接被多国（如加拿大、澳大利亚）引用为发放税务抵免或减排信用的技术依据。

ISO/TC 265 is the primary international body responsible for developing unified standards for the CCUS sector. Its portfolio of standards forms the technical backbone for global project compliance and environmental integrity. zh.title: IPCC 国家温室气体清单指南 (含 2019 修订版)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

IPCC 国家温室气体清单指南是全球各国编制国家排放清单（GHG Inventory）的最高技术准则。其 2006 版及 2019 修订版（2019 Refinement）确立了碳捕集与封存（CCS）在全球气候核算体系中的‘非排放’地位。根据该指南，被捕集并永久隔离在符合标准的深层地质储层中的 CO2，在计算国家总排放量时可予以扣除。

2019 修订版进一步细化了 CCS 的核算边界，将其划分为‘1C’类别，涵盖了 CO2 运输（含管网、船运、铁路）及注入过程中的逸散排放（Fugitive Emissions）。该指南强制要求捕集端的排放应归口于具体的工业或能源扇区（如‘燃料燃烧’），而运输与封存端的损耗则需单独核算。作为《巴黎协定》下各国提交透明度报告（BTR）的底层语言，IPCC 指南确保了全球范围内 CCUS 减排量的可比性与物理真实性，是防止双重计算和‘洗绿’行为的全球技术防线。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过确立 CCS 减排量的国际认可地位，为跨国碳抵销市场提供了统一的计价基准，消除了国际气候投融资中的方法学冲突风险。
impactAnalysis.technical: 2019 修订版强制推行对运输全环节（含新型船运路径）逸散排放的监测，推动了全球 CCUS 行业监测设备与传感器技术的精度升级。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为全球减排量核算的‘最后法官’，确保了地质封存贡献的长期环境保真度，支撑了全球净零目标的科学量化。

en.title: IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories (inc. 2019 Refinement)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories serve as the ultimate technical authority for nations to report their emissions and removals under the UNFCCC. The 2006 version and its 2019 Refinement formally recognize Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) as a legitimate mitigation pathway, allowing CO2 that is permanently sequestered in geological formations to be deducted from national totals.

The 2019 Refinement notably updated the boundary for CCS accounting, introducing the '1C' category to track fugitive emissions across the entire supply chain, including pipelines, shipping, and injection activities. It mandates that capture emissions be reported within their respective source sectors (e.g., Energy or IPPU), while losses during transport and storage are calculated separately. As the foundational language for Biennial Transparency Reports (BTRs) under the Paris Agreement, these guidelines ensure international comparability and prevent double-counting, serving as the global defense against environmental integrity risks.

impactAnalysis.economic: Standardizes the definition of 'avoided emissions' globally, providing the methodological certainty required for international carbon markets and climate finance.
impactAnalysis.technical: Enforces monitoring of fugitive emissions across multi-modal transport paths, accelerating the adoption of high-precision leak detection sensors in the industry.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Guarantees the long-term integrity of carbon storage removals, underpinning the scientific credibility of global net-zero commitments.

zh.title: 欧盟创新基金 (Innovation Fund)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

欧盟创新基金是目前全球最大的清洁技术资助计划之一，其资金主要来源于欧盟排放交易体系（EU ETS）的配额拍卖收入。作为欧盟‘净零工业法案（NZIA）’的核心财政引擎，该基金旨在支持具有开创性的低碳技术向大规模商业化转型。对于 CCUS 领域，创新基金不仅提供高达 **60% 的相关成本（Relevant Costs）** 资助，还通过竞争性竞价机制（Competitive Bidding）将资助比例提升至 100%。

2024 年发布的 IF24 招标案（IF24 Call）拥有 **24 亿欧元** 的专项预算，专门用于支持净零技术。在最近的一轮资助中，共有 16 个 CCS 项目获得了总计近 50 亿欧元的资助，覆盖了意大利、匈牙利、挪威和法国等 18 个国家。这些项目预计将贡献欧盟 2030 年 5000 万吨封存目标的 13%。通过这种大规模、跨国的直接拨款，欧盟创新基金成功对冲了 CCUS 项目的高初期资本风险，成为欧洲打造全球碳管理服务中心的关键推动力。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过提供高达 60%-100% 的相关成本资助，显著降低了 CCUS 项目进入 FID 的资金门槛，并将 EU ETS 的碳价成本转化为直接的低碳技术投资。
impactAnalysis.technical: 重点支持跨行业的集成项目（如水泥、钢铁捕集与跨境封存枢纽的耦合），推动了欧洲全产业链技术标准的统一与互通。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 直接支撑欧盟 NZIA 的 50 Mtpa 封存目标，是实现欧洲 2050 气候中和愿景的最主要财政抓手。

en.title: EU Innovation Fund
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The EU Innovation Fund is one of the world's largest funding programs for the deployment of net-zero and innovative technologies, fueled by revenues from the EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS). As the financial heart of the EU Net-Zero Industry Act (NZIA), it provides critical capital to bridge the commercial gap for large-scale decarbonization projects. For CCUS, the fund covers up to **60% of relevant costs** via traditional grants and up to **100%** through new competitive bidding auctions.

The 2024 (IF24) call allocated **€2.4 billion** specifically for net-zero technologies. In recent funding rounds, 16 major CCS projects across 18 Member States were selected for nearly €5 billion in grants, contributing significantly to the EU’s legally binding target of 50 Mtpa of CO2 injection capacity by 2030. By absorbing massive CAPEX risks, the fund is the primary catalyst for turning Europe into a global carbon management services market.

zh.title: 马来西亚 2025 年碳捕集、利用与封存法案 (CCUS Act)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

马来西亚《2025 年碳捕集、利用与封存法案》(CCUS Act 2025) 是东南亚首部针对 CCUS 全生命周期的专项母法。该法案于 2025 年 3 月获批并于同年 8 月正式生效，确立了马来西亚作为亚太地区碳管理枢纽的法律地位。其核心举措是成立了专门的监管机构——**马来西亚 CCUS 管理局 (MyCCUS)**，负责统筹全马（西马及纳闽）的许可发放、安全监管与合规审计。

法案引入了双层授权体系：**评估许可 (Assessment Permits)** 用于前期的地质详查，**封存许可 (Storage Licences)** 用于实际的注入与长期运营。最具战略意义的是，该法案正式允许二氧化碳的跨国流动，并配套了《2025 离岸许可条例》，为 PETRONAS 等企业利用马来西亚广阔的离岸枯竭气田（预估潜力达 15 Mtpa）接收来自日本、韩国等地的 CO2 提供了制度保障。此外，法案还设立了‘闭场后管护基金 (Post-Closure Stewardship Fund)’，通过征收注入费来覆盖长达数十年的环境监测责任。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过法律确立封存权的‘准物权’属性，为每座 CCUS 枢纽吸引了约 200 亿林吉特的潜在私营资本投资，并将马来西亚的自然封存资源转化为高收益的国际服务贸易资产。
impactAnalysis.technical: 强制推行基于风险的地质评估与环境监测标准，推动了离岸枯竭油气田向高效碳库转型的技术标准化，提升了马来西亚在热带海域封存监测领域的技术话语权。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为国家能源转型路线图 (NETR) 的法制底座，确保了物理上的碳封存具备法律可追溯性，支撑了 2030 年 1500 万吨的封存目标达标。

en.title: Malaysia Carbon Capture, Utilisation & Storage (CCUS) Act 2025
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Malaysia’s Carbon Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS) Act 2025 is the first standalone primary legislation in Southeast Asia covering the entire CCUS value chain. Coming into force on August 1, 2025, the Act establishes the **Malaysia Carbon Capture, Utilisation and Storage Agency (MyCCUS)** as the sole federal regulator for licensing, safety, and compliance. The framework introduces a sophisticated two-tier licensing system: **Assessment Permits** for preliminary geological characterization and **Storage Licences** for active injection and long-term reservoir management.

Strategically, the Act formalizes the international movement of CO2, positioning Malaysia as a premier regional hub for carbon sequestration services. By leveraging its vast offshore depleted gas fields (estimated at 15 Mtpa capacity), the legislation enables the import of CO2 from land-constrained nations like Japan and South Korea. Furthermore, it addresses long-term liability through a mandated **Post-Closure Stewardship Fund**, financed by injection levies, ensuring that environmental monitoring is sustained for decades beyond the project lifecycle.

impactAnalysis.economic: Unlocks an estimated RM 20 Billion in investment per Hub by providing clear property rights for sub-surface storage, converting natural geological assets into a scalable service-based export commodity.
impactAnalysis.technical: Enforces international standards for reservoir integrity and sub-sea leakage detection, accelerating the technical maturity of offshore-to-sequestration conversions in the Asia-Pacific.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Provides the physical and legal guarantee for permanent CO2 isolation, serving as the cornerstone for Malaysia’s NETR goals and regional 1.5°C contributions.

implementationDetails.mechanism: Two-tier Licensing (Assessment/Storage) & Post-Closure Stewardship Fund

zh.title: 荷兰可持续能源与气候转型激励计划 (SDE++)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

荷兰的 SDE++ 计划是全球领先的 CCfD（差价合约）模式典型案例，旨在通过补偿‘不具竞争力的成本部分’来驱动工业脱碳。该计划不仅支持可再生能源，更将 CCS 和 CCU 作为核心资助对象。其核心逻辑是：政府通过 15 年期的长期合约，补足企业实施 CCS 的成本（基准价）与市场碳价（EU ETS 价格）之间的差额。

2024 年的最新修订进一步增强了该计划的竞争力，将最高补贴强度设定为 **400 欧元/吨 CO2**。SDE++ 已成功为 Porthos 项目提供了 21 亿欧元的资金保障，支持 Rotterdam 工业区四大巨头实现每年 250 万吨的减排。此外，2024 年后的政策更新还首次允许资助跨境封存（如将 CO2 存储在挪威的海底储层），这一举措极大地提升了荷兰作为欧洲碳管理枢纽的地位。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 CCfD 机制补偿 CCS 成本与 ETS 碳价之间的价差，为长达 15 年的项目运营提供了极高的财务确定性，解决了大型基建融资的风险瓶颈。
impactAnalysis.technical: 推动了 Porthos 和 Aramis 等超大型共享管网基础设施的建设，实现了炼油、化工、制氢等多行业捕集技术的大规模集成试点。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为荷兰工业减排的财政心脏，旨在通过 CCS 每年贡献超过 1000 万吨的减排量，支撑 2030 气候目标。

en.title: Netherlands SDE++ Climate Transition Incentive Scheme
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The Netherlands' SDE++ scheme is a premier global example of the Carbon Contract for Difference (CCfD) model, designed to bridge the 'unprofitable component' of decarbonization technologies. For CCS and CCU, the scheme provides a 15-year operating subsidy that covers the gap between the full project cost (Base Price) and the market value of avoided emissions (EU ETS Price).

In 2024, the scheme was significantly updated with a maximum subsidy intensity of **€400 per tonne of CO2 saved**. SDE++ has been instrumental in the FID of the Porthos project, providing €2.1 billion in grant reservations for major industrial players in the Rotterdam area. Critically, as of 2024, the scheme now supports cross-border CO2 storage—allowing Dutch industrial emitters to sequester carbon in Norwegian North Sea reservoirs—solidifying the Netherlands' role as Europe's central carbon management hub.

impactAnalysis.economic: Internalizes the carbon price through a stable 15-year payout, turning volatile ETS signals into bankable cash flows for multi-billion euro infrastructures.
impactAnalysis.technical: Drives the development of open-access Hub-and-Spoke transport networks (Porthos/Aramis), enabling multi-sector industrial capture at scale.
impactAnalysis.environmental: The financial backbone of the Dutch industrial transition, targeting over 10 Mtpa of storage by 2030 to meet Paris Agreement commitments.

zh.description:
## 政策概览

加利福尼亚州低碳燃料标准 (LCFS) 是全球最重要的运输部门减排机制之一。其核心创新在于其专门的 CCUS 议定书 (CCUS Protocol)，允许捕集并永久封存二氧化碳的项目产生 LCFS 信用额度。由于 LCFS 信用价格通常处于高位（历史峰值超 200 美元/吨），该政策为美国的直接空气捕集 (DAC) 和生物质能与碳捕集封存 (BECCS) 项目提供了极具吸引力的额外收入来源，是北美 CCUS 商业化的重要驱动力。
zh.interpretation: LCFS CCUS 协议是全球最成功的市场化减排工具之一，其独特的‘积分叠加’效应极大提升了直接空气捕集 (DAC) 等昂贵技术的项目可行性。

impactAnalysis.technical: 依托成熟的 LCFS CCS Protocol，支持全生命周期的碳强度核算，并严格限制生物燃料来源，引导技术流向高环境保真度路径。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为加州 2045 碳中和的核心工具，LCFS 已通过市场机制成功吸引了全球范围内的 CCS 投资，支撑了交通运输行业的深度脱碳。

zh.description:
## 政策概览

阿尔伯塔省的 TIER 体系是加拿大乃至全球最成熟的工业级碳定价与 CCS 激励框架之一。该政策通过设定工业设施的排放基准，强制要求超标企业缴纳碳费或购买抵消额度。2024-2025 年的修订带来了重大变革：首先，TIER 基金价格被冻结在每吨 **95 加元**（2025年），并计划每年增加 15 加元，到 2030 年达到 **170 加元**，为 CCS 项目提供了明确且高额的碳价地板。

此外，修订版将合规抵销限额从 70% 逐步提升至 **90%**（2026年起），极大地释放了碳封存额度（Sequestration Credits）的市场需求。配套的 **“阿尔伯塔碳捕集激励计划 (ACCIP)”** 还提供了 12% 的额外资本补助，旨在与联邦 CCUS ITC 形成财政叠加。这一体系通过稳定的碳价预期和灵活的合规路径，使阿尔伯塔省成为全球 CCUS 商业化运营的高地，支撑了油砂、化肥和电力等核心行业的深度脱碳。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 2030 年升至 $170/t 的高确定性碳价地板，TIER 彻底改变了 CCS 项目的财务模型，使其从单纯的合规支出转变为高收益的碳资产项目。
impactAnalysis.technical: 显式激励大规模地质封存（Sequestration Credits），推动了油砂产区共享管网与集中式封存集群的技术标准化与规模化建设。

en.title: Alberta TIER System & CCS Incentives (2024/2025 Amendments)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Alberta’s TIER (Technology Innovation and Emissions Reduction) system is a globally recognized benchmark for industrial carbon pricing. It functions as a baseline-and-credit market where high-emitting facilities must pay into the TIER Fund or purchase credits to meet emission standards. The 2024-2025 updates brought critical enhancements: the fund price is set at **CAD 95/t** for 2025 and is mandated to rise by CAD 15 annually to **CAD 170/t by 2030**, establishing a rock-solid price floor for CCS investments.

Furthermore, the amendments raise the compliance offset limit to **90%** by 2026, significantly increasing the market value of 'Sequestration Credits'. Coupled with the **Alberta Carbon Capture Incentive Program (ACCIP)**, which offers a 12% capital grant designed to stack with Canada’s federal 50% ITC, TIER provides a comprehensive financial stack. This makes Alberta one of the most attractive jurisdictions for large-scale carbon management in sectors like oil sands, petrochemicals, and power.

impactAnalysis.technical: Incentivizes the development of massive 'Hub-and-Spoke' transport networks, proving large-scale industrial capture and storage integration in sub-arctic climates.
impactAnalysis.environmental: The primary engine for meeting Canada’s 2030 targets at the provincial level, aimed at decarbonizing the oil sands—the nation's largest emission source.

zh.title: 挪威“长船”全产业链 CCS 示范计划 (Longship)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

挪威‘长船’（Longship）计划是全球首个建立完整、跨国、工业级 CCUS 价值链的国家级示范工程。该计划总投资额约 340 亿克朗（约 29.4 亿欧元），其中挪威政府承担了约三分之二的费用，涵盖了前十年的建设与运营支出。其核心构成包括：位于 Brevik 的海德堡水泥捕集厂（年捕集 40 万吨）、位于奥斯陆的 Hafslund 垃圾发电捕集厂（预估 2029 年投运），以及连接捕集端与封存端的 **Northern Lights（北光）** 运输与存储基础设施。

2025 年夏季，长船计划达成重大历史里程碑：北光设施正式开启商业化运营，首船来自 Brevik 水泥厂的液化 CO2 成功注入北海海底 2600 米深处的盐水层。这一计划的战略意义在于它证明了‘封存即服务（Storage as a Service）’跨国模式的可行性，北光项目已与荷兰 Yara、丹麦 Ørsted 等多家欧洲企业签署商业协议。作为欧洲碳管理的‘心脏’，长船计划不仅通过政府背书大幅降低了私营部门的投资风险，还确立了海运二氧化碳运输的全球技术标准。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过政府直接覆盖约 80% 的资本开支与十年运营费用，长船计划彻底解决了 CCS 产业化早期的‘死亡谷’风险，使北光合资公司能够以具竞争力的价格向欧洲工业界提供存储服务。
impactAnalysis.technical: 首创了大规模低压液化 CO2 海运技术标准，并验证了从捕集端、中转站到深海盐水层回注的全流程工业集成，填补了全球在跨国碳物流领域的技术空白。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为挪威实现 2050 净零承诺的关键物理手段，该计划不仅直接减排挪威境内水泥与垃圾处理行业的碳足迹，还为全欧洲工业深度脱碳提供了稳定、可核证的封存底座。

en.title: Norway's 'Longship' Full-scale CCS Project
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Longship is the Norwegian government’s ambitious project to demonstrate a complete, large-scale, and cost-effective industrial CCS value chain. With a total budget of NOK 34 billion (approx. €2.94 billion), the Norwegian state funds approximately two-thirds of the costs, covering both capital investment and the first ten years of operations. The project integrates carbon capture at the Heidelberg Materials cement plant in Brevik (400 ktpa) and the Hafslund waste-to-energy plant in Oslo (set for 2029) with the **Northern Lights** transport and storage network.

In mid-2025, Longship reached full operational status as the Northern Lights facility officially opened for commercial use, injecting the first volumes of liquified CO2 into a saline aquifer 2600m beneath the North Sea. The strategic impact of Longship lies in proving the 'Storage-as-a-Service' model, where Northern Lights accepts CO2 from diverse European industrial clusters. By absorbing the massive initial risks, Norway has created the regulatory and technical blueprint for offshore CO2 shipping and storage, anchoring Europe’s industrial decarbonization market.

impactAnalysis.technical: Establishes the global standard for low-pressure LCO2 shipping and large-scale saline aquifer injection, bridging the infrastructure gap between mainland capture and offshore sinks.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Serves as the physical motor for Norway's 2050 climate goals and provides a verified, permanent sink for hard-to-abate sectors across the EU, preventing carbon leakage.

zh.title: Verra 碳捕集与封存核证方法学 (VM0049)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

Verra 的 VM0049 方法学于 2024 年 6 月正式发布，是目前全球自愿碳市场（VCM）中覆盖面最广、最具模块化的 CCS 核证标准。该方法学旨在为生成高质量的碳移除（CDR）额度和排放减量信用提供统一的物理量化框架。其核心优势在于其**模块化结构**：项目开发者可以根据具体的捕集来源（如空气、生物质、天然气加工）、运输方式及封存地质（如盐水层、枯竭油气藏）灵活选择对应的 VMD 模块进行组合。

2024-2025 年间，Verra 密集发布了多项配套工具，包括专门针对直接空气捕集 (DAC) 的 VMD0056 模块和针对生物质能捕集 (Bio-CCS) 的 VMD0059 模块。VM0049 强制要求执行严苛的‘额外性’检测（需证明没有碳信贷收益项目将无法推进），并确立了对 100 年以上封存永久性的监测要求。通过将 CCS 减排量数字化并接入 Verra Project Hub，该政策为全球范围内的 CCS 项目通过国际资本市场实现碳资产溢价提供了标准化的‘度量衡’。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过确立方法学确定性，显著提升了 DAC 等昂贵碳移除路径的信贷溢价，吸引了科技巨头（如微软、谷歌）的长协采购资金流入 CCS 产业。
impactAnalysis.technical: 模块化设计（Modular Approach）推动了行业在跨行业捕集、长距离输送及复杂地质封存核算上的标准化，消除了不同技术路径间的核证壁垒。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为全球高保真减排的制度保障，通过 100 年封存永久性要求和强制风险缓冲池，确保了 CCS 减排量对 1.5°C 目标的物理贡献真实性。

en.title: Verra Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) Methodology (VM0049)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Released in June 2024, Verra’s VM0049 is the most comprehensive and modular CCS methodology in the Voluntary Carbon Market (VCM). Designed to quantify both carbon dioxide removals (CDRs) and emission reductions, the methodology utilizes a modular framework that allows developers to customize their verification process based on specific capture sources (Direct Air, Bioenergy, Natural Gas), transport modes, and storage environments (Saline Aquifers, Depleted Reservoirs). 

Throughout 2024 and 2025, Verra added critical modules such as VMD0056 for DAC and VMD0059 for Bio-CCS, alongside digital tools to streamline project registration. VM0049 enforces strict 'Additionality' tests—ensuring projects would not proceed without carbon finance—and mandates monitoring for 100+ years of storage permanence. By digitizing CCS outcomes and integrating them into the Verra Project Hub, this policy provides the global 'gold standard' for turning physical sequestration into bankable, high-integrity carbon assets.

zh.description:
## 政策概览

黄金标准 (Gold Standard for the Global Goals) 是全球自愿碳市场中对‘高诚信度’和‘可持续发展贡献’要求最严苛的核证体系。2024-2025 年间，该机构发布了里程碑式的《工程化碳移除活动要求》，正式确立了针对 CCS 项目的核证路径。该框架涵盖了从生物质发酵耦合 CCS (BECCS)、碳矿化（如混凝土碳化）到工业点源捕集的完整路径。

黄金标准的核心特色在于其 **“可持续发展目标 (SDGs) 强制关联”**：所有获证项目必须证明对至少 3 项联合国 SDGs 目标有实质贡献。2025 年发布的《地质封存监测要求》进一步定义了‘损失事件’的严格阈值（超过 1 吨或注入总量的 0.001% 即视为失效），并要求所有信用额度自 2026 年起必须完全对齐《巴黎协定》第 6 条。通过建立高标准的‘逆转风险缓冲池’和数字化审计平台，黄金标准为全球范围内兼具减排实效与社会环境正义的 CCS 项目提供了最权威的溢价背书。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过极高的品牌信用消除市场质疑，为 CCS 项目创造了远超行业平均水平的信贷溢价（GSVERs），吸引了科技巨头和主权财富基金等高质量 ESG 资本。
impactAnalysis.technical: 显式激励‘工程化负排放’与‘长期矿化封存’技术，推动了行业在 1000 年以上封存持久性评估与 SDGs 量化核算上的技术标准化。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为全球减排诚信度的‘守门人’，确保了每一吨获证的二氧化碳均对应真实的社会环境效益，防止了单纯追求减排量而忽视生态影响的风险。

en.title: Gold Standard for the Global Goals (GS4GG)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Gold Standard for the Global Goals is widely recognized as the most rigorous certification framework in the voluntary carbon market, emphasizing not only high-integrity emission reductions but also tangible contributions to the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). In 2024-2025, the organization launched its **Engineered Removals Activity Requirements**, formalizing the pathway for CCS-based activities including BECCS, carbon mineralization, and point-source industrial capture.

A unique pillar of Gold Standard is its mandatory link to sustainable development: every certified project must demonstrate measurable progress on at least three SDGs. The 2025 update to 'Geological Storage Requirements' introduces an industry-leading 'Loss Event' threshold—treating any leakage over 1 tonne or 0.001% of total storage as a non-compliance event. By mandating full alignment with Paris Agreement Article 6 by 2026 and enforcing a robust reversal buffer pool, Gold Standard provides the definitive verification layer for high-quality negative emission assets that command a significant price premium globally.

zh.title: Puro.earth 碳移除核证标准 (CORC)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

Puro.earth 是全球首个专注于工程化碳移除（CDR）的核证标准与交易平台，目前由纳斯达克（Nasdaq）控股。其核心使命是通过签发 **CORCs（二氧化碳移除证书）**，为能够将碳锁定 1000 年以上的技术路径提供信用背书。2024 年，Puro.earth 发布了修订版《地质封存碳（GSC）方法学》，正式将计入期从 5 年延长至 15 年，并对 DACS 和 BECCS 项目实施了更严苛的生命周期评估（LCA）要求。

Puro.earth 的独特价值在于其 **“价格发现机制”**。通过与 Nasdaq 合作建立的 CORC 指数系列，该平台为全球 CDR 市场提供了稀缺的价格透明度。2024 年更新的方法学强制要求存储的 CO2 纯度需达到 95% 以上，并明确禁止将 CCS 用于强化采油（EOR）或与煤炭共燃的 BECCS 设施。通过 Pre-CORC 框架，该平台还允许早期项目在正式运营前预售未来收益，为全球百万吨级负排放项目的商业闭环提供了核心的金融基础设施。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过与纳斯达克指数集成实现价格透明，为 CORCs 确立了全球 CDR 市场的定价基准，吸引了微软、摩根大通等科技与金融巨头的长期大宗采购。
impactAnalysis.technical: 显式区分并定义了 1000 年以上的‘永久封存’技术门槛，推动了 DACS、Bio-CCS 及矿化封存路径在生命周期碳足迹核算上的深度标准化。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为负排放市场的‘守门人’，通过禁绝 EOR 相关项目及严格的生物质可持续性审核，确保了获证项目对全球控温目标的物理纯洁性。

en.title: Puro.earth Carbon Removal Standard (CORC)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Puro.earth is the world's leading certification standard and marketplace dedicated exclusively to engineered Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDR), now a Nasdaq-controlled entity. Its primary function is the issuance of **CO2 Removal Certificates (CORCs)**, verifying sequestration technologies capable of locking carbon away for over 1000 years. In 2024, Puro.earth released its updated 'Geologically Stored Carbon (GSC) Methodology,' extending the crediting period to 15 years and mandating rigorous Life Cycle Assessments (LCA) for DACS and BECCS projects.

The unique value proposition of Puro.earth is its **Price Discovery Mechanism**. Through the CORC Index family developed with Nasdaq, the platform provides critical transparency for the global CDR market. The 2024 update enforces a 95% CO2 purity threshold and explicitly prohibits the use of CCS for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) or BECCS facilities that co-fire coal. Via its Pre-CORC framework, the platform also enables early-stage projects to secure multi-year revenue commitments from tech giants like Microsoft and Google, providing the essential financial infrastructure for megatonne-scale negative emission deployments.

zh.title: 美国 IIJA 碳捕集与封存枢纽建设计划
zh.description:
## 政策概览

美国《基础设施投资与就业法案》(IIJA)，又称跨党派基础设施法 (BIL)，是美国 CCUS 基础设施现代化的基石。该法案拨付了总计约 **120 亿美元** 的专项资金用于碳管理，重点支持大规模‘枢纽化’开发。其核心计划包括：**35 亿美元** 的区域直接空气捕集 (DAC) 枢纽计划（旨在建设 4 个年捕集量超 100 万吨的枢纽）、**25 亿美元** 的碳捕集示范项目，以及 **22.5 亿美元** 的碳存储验证与测试计划。

2024 年，该计划进入密集落地期。美国能源部 (DOE) 旗下的清洁能源示范办公室 (OCED) 宣布为 23 个大型封存项目提供 5.18 亿美元资助，覆盖全美 19 个州。与 45Q 税收抵免不同，IIJA 专注于解决‘公共基础设施’属性的投入，如共享的 CO2 运输管网和集中封存场。通过这种大规模的联邦直投，IIJA 与 IRA 形成了‘基建补初装，45Q 补运营’的互补格局，旨在将美国打造为全球 CCUS 产业的领导者。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 120 亿美元的联邦直投，显著降低了超大型基础设施项目的非对称开发风险，使百万吨级 DAC 与集中式封存枢纽具备了初步的商业化可行性。
impactAnalysis.technical: 重点驱动了 DAC 技术从实验原型向百万吨级商业模块的跨越，并验证了北美大陆多种复杂地质结构下的长期封存安全性。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为美国工业深度脱碳的基础设施底座，旨在通过枢纽化效应支撑 2050 年实现净零排放的国家愿景。

en.title: US IIJA Carbon Capture & Storage Hubs Program
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA), also known as the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL), represents the most significant investment in carbon management infrastructure in US history. It allocates approximately **$12 billion** across several programs administered by the Department of Energy (DOE). Key highlights include **$3.5 billion** for Regional Direct Air Capture (DAC) Hubs (targeting 4 hubs with >1 Mtpa capacity each), **$2.5 billion** for Carbon Capture Demonstrations, and **$2.25 billion** for the Carbon Storage Validation and Testing Program (CarbonSAFE).

In 2024, the program hit major milestones, with over $518 million awarded to 23 storage-focused projects across 19 states. Unlike the 45Q tax credit, which provides operational support, IIJA funding targets the 'public utility' aspects of CCUS—shared transport networks and centralized storage complexes. This dual-track approach (IIJA for CAPEX/Infrastructure and IRA for OPEX) creates a robust fiscal environment intended to solidify US leadership in the global carbon management sector.

impactAnalysis.technical: Propels DAC technology from pilot scales to megatonne commerciality and provides nationwide validation of diversified geological storage formations.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Constructs the necessary physical network to enable massive-scale industrial decarbonization, aligning with the US 2050 Net Zero commitment.

zh.title: 巴西第 1425/2022 号法案 (CCS 法律框架)
zh.description: 巴西第 1425/2022 号法案是该国确立 CCS 产业合法地位的关键立法。该法案于 2023 年 11 月通过能源委员会审查，目前正处于众议院最终审批阶段。配合 2024 年 10 月通过的《未来燃料法案》(PL 528/2023)，巴西正式授权国家石油、天然气与生物燃料管理局 (ANP) 作为 CCS 的主责监管机构。法案确立了封存权的租赁制度和 30 年的长期责任监测期，旨在利用巴西在生物乙醇捕集与盐下油田封存方面的巨大潜力，打造全球领先的低碳燃油与负排放基地。

en.title: Brazil Bill 1425/2022: CCS Legal Framework
en.description: Brazil’s Bill 1425/2022 is the definitive legislative vehicle for establishing the legal status of Carbon Capture and Storage in the country. Approved by the Senate in late 2023 and integrated with the 'Fuels of the Future' Act (PL 528/2023) in October 2024, it designates the National Agency of Petroleum, Natural Gas and Biofuels (ANP) as the primary regulator. The Bill codifies a 30-year post-closure monitoring period and a specialized leasing regime for geological pore space. Strategically, it leverages Brazil’s massive potential in bio-ethanol capture and pre-salt oil reservoir sequestration to position the nation as a global negative-emission leader and a source of high-integrity carbon removals.

zh.description: 阿联酋《2050 净零战略》是该国实现能源多元化与气候主权的顶层蓝图。该战略包含 25 个子计划，覆盖电力、工业、交通等六大核心行业。对于 CCUS 领域，阿联酋设定了极其宏伟的目标：计划通过 CCS 技术削减工业领域 **32%** 的排放量。2024 年 6 月，阿联酋发布了第 67 号内阁决议，正式建立**国家碳信用注册登记簿 (NRCC)**，并配套了将于 2025 年 5 月生效的《减少气候变化影响联邦法令》。通过 ADNOC 等巨头的牵头，阿联酋旨在利用其丰富的枯竭油气藏打造全球最具规模的碳管理中心。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过建立国家碳信用注册登记簿，为石油和重工业资产通过碳资产溢价实现低碳转型提供了金融底座。
impactAnalysis.technical: 推动了在中东高温高盐环境下进行二氧化碳大规模注入与监测的技术标准化，确立了全球石油巨头向碳管理服务商转型的范式。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 直接支撑阿联酋实现 2050 年净零排放目标，旨在通过 CCS 每年减排数千万吨工业二氧化碳。

In June 2024, the UAE introduced Cabinet Resolution No. 67, establishing the **National Register of Carbon Credits (NRCC)**, a pivotal move to formalize carbon asset trading. Complemented by the Federal Decree-Law No. (11) of 2024, the strategy empowers national champions like ADNOC to convert vast offshore depleted fields into global carbon management hubs, cementing the UAE’s leadership in the regional low-carbon economy.

impactAnalysis.environmental: Provides the necessary physical framework to meet the UAE's COP28 pledges, facilitating massive-scale reductions in the hard-to-abate energy and cement sectors.

zh.title: 马来西亚 MIDA CCUS 投资税收激励
zh.description: 马来西亚投资发展局 (MIDA) 确立了全球最具竞争力的 CCUS 财税激励体系。根据 2024 年预算案及同年 9 月发布的豁免令，从事 CCS 活动的企业可享受 **100% 的投资税收抵免 (ITA)**，抵扣期长达 10 年。此外，CCS 专用设备在 2023-2027 年间享受全额进口税与销售税豁免。对于提供 CCS 服务的第三方实体，则可选择 70% 的所得税免除。这一政策通过‘重金补贴’模式，极大地降低了马来西亚作为东南亚封存枢纽的准入成本，吸引了全球碳管理资本的加速流入。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 100% 的 ITA 政策极大提升了大型封存设施的税后净现值 (NPV)，将高昂的 CAPEX 转化为即时的税务利润，确立了马来西亚在吸引全球 CCUS FIDs 方面的非对称优势。
impactAnalysis.technical: 重点激励了高性能捕集溶剂与长距离海底管道的技术进口，通过免税政策加速了国际先进 CCUS 装备在东南亚的本地化应用。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为 NETR 路线图的财政保障，确保了 2030 年 1500 万吨封存目标的经济可行性，支撑了该区域作为全球碳移除节点的生态闭环。

en.title: Malaysia MIDA CCUS Investment Incentives

Additionally, specialized CCS equipment is fully exempt from import duties and sales tax through 2027. For third-party CCS service providers, a 70% income tax exemption is offered. This 'heavy-subsidy' model dramatically lowers the entry barrier for Malaysia’s emergence as a regional sequestration hub, successfully mobilizing global capital toward its offshore storage assets.

zh.title: 德国工业碳管理战略 (ICM Strategy)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

德国《工业碳管理战略》(ICMS) 标志着该国在碳管理政策上的历史性转折。2024 年 5 月通过的 ICMS 正式确认，要实现 2045 年气候中和目标，商业规模的 CCS/CCU 是不可或缺的。战略的核心突破是允许在德国专属经济区（EEZ）和大陆架开发离岸二氧化碳封存场（排除海洋保护区），并引入了针对各联邦州的陆上封存‘选择性准入 (Opt-in)’机制。

为了落实该战略，德国同步修订了《二氧化碳存储法》(KSpG)，确立了二氧化碳管网建设的法律框架，并首次从法律上允许捕集二氧化碳的跨国出口。战略将二氧化碳管道和封存项目定义为‘具有压倒性的公共利益’，旨在极速化行政审批流程。值得注意的是，该战略明确排除了燃煤发电厂接入管网的权利，优先保障水泥、化肥等难减排重工业的封存需求，确立了德国作为清洁工业技术高地的竞争路径。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过法律确立‘压倒性公共利益’地位，大幅缩短了大型基础设施的审批与诉讼周期，降低了项目的机会成本，并引导百亿级欧元资本流向德国二氧化碳骨干网建设。
impactAnalysis.technical: 战略性地推动了针对北海大陆架的地质封存场址普查与技术验证，加速了德国重工业集群（如鲁尔区）与北海存储枢纽之间的跨境管道技术互通。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为德国 2045 气候中和的物理保障，确保了工业流程中不可避免的残余排放能够得到永久地质封存，维护了德国制造在低碳时代的全球领先地位。

en.title: Germany's Industrial Carbon Management Strategy (ICMS)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Germany’s 2024 Industrial Carbon Management Strategy (ICMS) represents a historic pivot in the nation's climate policy. Officially approved by the Federal Cabinet in May 2024, the strategy confirms that large-scale CCS/CCU is essential for reaching Germany's 2045 climate neutrality goal. The framework’s most significant breakthrough is the authorization of offshore CO2 storage within Germany’s Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) and continental shelf, alongside an 'opt-in' mechanism allowing individual federal states to permit onshore storage at their discretion.

To implement the strategy, the government is amending the Carbon Dioxide Storage Act (KSpG) to establish a clear legal regime for CO2 pipeline construction and to legalize the export of CO2 for international sequestration. By declaring CO2 infrastructure to be of 'overriding public interest,' the ICMS aims to radically accelerate permitting and reduce legal hurdles. Critically, the strategy prioritizes hard-to-abate sectors like cement and chemicals, while explicitly excluding coal-fired power plants from network access, ensuring that limited storage resources are utilized for the nation’s strategic industrial transformation.

impactAnalysis.economic: The 'overriding public interest' status slashes administrative delays and litigation risks, lowering the cost of capital for multi-billion EUR CO2 backbone networks across industrial heartlands.
impactAnalysis.technical: Triggers intensive geological characterization of the German North Sea and standardizes the technical requirements for cross-border CO2 transport hubs linking the Ruhr area to international sinks.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Provides the physical guarantee for Germany's 2045 net-zero commitment, ensuring that unavoidable process emissions are permanently sequestered while safeguarding marine ecosystems through strict exclusion zones.

zh.description: 法国于 2024 年 7 月发布了更新版国家 CCUS 战略，明确将其作为重工业脱碳的强制性路径。战略设定了分阶段目标：2030 年实现 4-8 Mtpa，2050 年推向 30-50 Mtpa。法国政府已启动针对 CCS 的 **碳差价合约 (CCfDs)** 公开征询，计划提供长达 15 年的运营补贴。此外，法国与挪威在 2024 年签署了战略协议，计划于 2026 年起通过北海设施每年跨境封存 500 万吨 CO2。该路线图确立了 Dunkirk 和 Fos-sur-Mer 等四大工业枢纽作为早期部署的物理核心。

en.title: France National CCUS Roadmap 2024
en.description: France unveiled its updated CCUS deployment roadmap in July 2024, positioning the technology as an essential component of the nation's industrial decarbonization. A key pillar is the launch of **Carbon Contracts for Difference (CCfDs)**, providing 15-year revenue support for capture projects. Furthermore, a 2024 bilateral agreement with Norway enables the export of up to 5 Mtpa of French CO2 to North Sea storage sites by 2026. The roadmap prioritizes four key industrial hubs, including Dunkirk and Fos-sur-Mer, turning them into the physical epicenters of Europe’s expanding carbon management market.

zh.title: 沙特“循环碳经济”与朱拜勒 CCS 枢纽战略
zh.description:
## 政策概览

沙特阿拉伯的 CCUS 战略是其‘循环碳经济 (Circular Carbon Economy, CCE)’框架的核心支柱。该战略由沙特在 2020 年 G20 峰会期间提出并推广，确立了‘减少、重用、回收、移除’四大原则。作为实现 2060 净零排放目标的关键路径，沙特设定了极其宏伟的阶段性目标：到 **2035 年实现每年 4400 万吨 (44 Mtpa) 的 CO2 捕捉与封存能力**。

该战略的旗舰工程是位于朱拜勒 (Jubail) 的大型 CCS 集群。该枢纽一期计划于 2027 年投入运营，初始设计产能为 900 万吨/年，其中沙特阿美 (Aramco) 提供约 600 万吨，其余来自周边工业区。沙特不仅将 CCUS 视为减排工具，更将其作为生产‘全球碳强度最低’氢能与石化产品的竞争优势。通过主权基金支持和沙特阿美的技术领导，沙特正在加速从资源出口国向全球碳管理服务中心的战略转型。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过规模化的朱拜勒枢纽显著降低单位碳减排成本，支撑沙特在蓝氢、蓝氨等新型低碳能源领域的全球出口溢价竞争力。

en.title: Saudi Circular Carbon Economy (CCE) & Jubail CCS Hub Strategy
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Saudi Arabia’s CCUS strategy is built upon the Circular Carbon Economy (CCE) framework, a model it successfully championed during its 2020 G20 Presidency. Based on the 4Rs (Reduce, Reuse, Recycle, Remove), the strategy sets a massive milestone: reaching **44 million tonnes per annum (Mtpa) of CO2 storage by 2035**. This is a non-negotiable pillar for the Kingdom’s 2060 Net Zero target.

The flagship Jubail CCS Hub, scheduled for 2027 startup, will initially capture 9 Mtpa, anchored by Aramco’s 6 Mtpa contribution. By leveraging sovereign wealth and Aramco’s engineering dominance, Saudi Arabia is not just decarbonizing but positioning its energy exports—particularly Blue Hydrogen and Blue Ammonia—as the lowest carbon intensity products in the world, securing a long-term competitive edge in the global energy transition.

impactAnalysis.economic: Achieves massive economies of scale through the 44 Mtpa roadmap, ensuring Saudi energy products command a premium in future low-carbon markets.
impactAnalysis.technical: Establishes global leadership in gigascale industrial capture networks and high-pressure saline aquifer injection technologies.
impactAnalysis.environmental: The primary tool for neutralizing residual emissions from the world's largest upstream operations, mitigating 44 Mt annually by 2035.

zh.title: 泰国 BOI 碳捕集与封存激励优惠政策
zh.description:
## 政策概览

泰国的 CCUS 激励机制由其投资委员会 (BOI) 深度管理，是该国‘绿色转型’五年战略（2023-2027）的核心部分。根据 2024 年的最新指引，凡在石化生产和天然气分离厂中集成 CCUS 技术的项目，均可申请最高等级的投资优惠：**长达 8 年的企业所得税 (CIT) 减免期**。这一政策旨在对冲初期高昂的设备投入成本，并加速泰国东部经济走廊 (EEC) 的工业脱碳。

除了所得税假期外，获批项目还可享受进口机器设备的关税豁免，以及用于出口产品生产的原材料关税减免。BOI 通过这一机制，不仅为 PTTEP 等国家能源公司在泰国湾的 CCS 枢纽项目提供了财务背书，更试图吸引全球清洁技术开发商落户泰国。这一政策使泰国成为东盟地区对 CCUS 资本支出支持力度最大的国家之一，直接支撑了其 2050 碳中和的国家目标。

impactAnalysis.economic: 8 年免税期显著提升了项目的内部收益率 (IRR)，通过降低税收支出变相提供了大规模的运营现金流支持。
impactAnalysis.technical: 显式引导石化与天然气分离行业的技术升级，利用泰国的优势工业基础推动高浓度捕集路径的规模化应用。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为泰国 2050 碳中和目标的关键财政驱动力，支撑工业部门每年减少数百万吨的工艺过程排放。

en.title: Thailand BOI CCUS Investment Promotion Incentives
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Managed by the Board of Investment (BOI), Thailand's CCUS incentives are a centerpiece of the 2023-2027 'Green Transformation' strategy. Under the 2024 update, projects integrating CCUS in petrochemical and natural gas separation sectors are eligible for the maximum investment incentive: **an 8-year Corporate Income Tax (CIT) holiday**. This policy is specifically designed to offset high initial capital costs and facilitate industrial decarbonization in the Eastern Economic Corridor (EEC).

Additionally, promoted projects benefit from import duty exemptions on machinery and raw materials for export production. The BOI framework provides crucial financial backing for the country's national energy hub projects, such as PTTEP's initiatives in the Gulf of Thailand. By offering one of the most aggressive fiscal support packages in ASEAN, Thailand aims to attract global clean-tech leaders and secure its path to 2050 carbon neutrality.

impactAnalysis.technical: Specifically targets Thailand's dominant industrial base in petrochemicals and gas processing, steering technical expertise toward high-concentration capture.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Acts as the financial motor for Thailand's 2050 decarbonization targets, aiming to mitigate significant process emissions across industrial clusters.

zh.description:
## 政策概览

印度在 2025 年 12 月正式发布了其国家 CCUS 路线图，标志着这个全球第三大排放国进入了技术脱碳的实战阶段。该路线图由科学技术部 (DST) 领衔，将印度的 CCUS 进程划分为三个阶段：2025-2030 年为基础研究与试点示范期；2030-2035 年为工业集成与监管完善期；2035-2045 年进入全面商业化扩展期。

为了匹配这一雄心勃勃的路线图，印度政府在 **2026-27 联邦预算案**中开创性地拨付了 **2000 亿卢比（约 22 亿美元）** 的专项资金，计划在未来五年内重点支持钢铁、水泥和电力等高排放行业的捕集技术规模化。此外，印度正在探索类似于太阳能领域的生产挂钩激励 (PLI) 计划和可行性缺口资金 (VGF)，旨在将 CCUS 整合入国家排放交易体系 (ETS)，并以此应对欧盟碳边境调节机制 (CBAM) 对印度出口竞争力的潜在挑战。

impactAnalysis.technical: 重点聚焦于针对印度本土高灰分燃料的捕集效率优化，以及钢铁、化工等硬减排集群的大规模技术集成方案。

en.title: India National CCUS R&D and Deployment Roadmap (2025-2045)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

India launched its comprehensive CCUS roadmap in December 2025, signaling a strategic shift for the world's third-largest emitter towards technical decarbonization. Led by the Department of Science and Technology (DST), the roadmap outlines a phased approach: Pilot and R&D (2025-2030), Industrial Integration (2030-2035), and Commercial Scale-up (2035-2045).

To match this ambition, the **2026-27 Union Budget** allocated a historic **200 billion rupees (approx. $2.2 billion USD)** for CCUS over five years. This fund is designed to bridge the viability gap for carbon-intensive sectors such as steel, cement, and power. India is also exploring Production Linked Incentives (PLI) and integration with its domestic Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) to maintain export competitiveness under the pressure of global carbon border adjustments like the EU CBAM.

impactAnalysis.technical: Focuses on capture energy efficiency for high-ash fuels and large-scale industrial cluster integration in heavy industry belts.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Projected to mitigate up to 750 million tonnes annually by 2050, serving as a non-negotiable pillar for India's 2070 Net Zero milestone.

zh.title: 冰岛碳移除 (CDR) 与矿化封存监管框架
zh.description:
## 政策概览

冰岛作为全球玄武岩矿化封存技术的先驱，已建立了一套独特的碳移除（CDR）监管框架。该体系通过将欧盟 CCS 指令转化为国内法，并结合冰岛特有的地质特征进行了系统性创新。其核心技术路径由 **Carbfix** 领衔，通过将捕捉的 CO2 溶解在水中并注入玄武岩层，在两年内将其转化为稳定的固体矿物。

2025 年 4 月，冰岛环境与能源局授予了欧洲首个符合欧盟标准的陆上地质封存许可，允许 Carbfix 在 Hellisheiði 场地每年封存 10.6 万吨 CO2。该框架不仅规范了针对地热发电厂伴生排放的捕集，还为 Climeworks 的 Orca 和 Mammoth 等百万吨级 DAC（直接空气捕集）设施提供了法制保障。随着 Coda Terminal 等工业级封存枢纽的推进，冰岛的 CDR 框架正成为全球‘永久性负排放’路径的监管范式，确立了矿化封存的长期安全与核证标准。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过法律确立矿化封存的‘永久性’定义，显著提升了冰岛产生的 CDR 碳信贷在国际自愿与合规市场中的溢价，解决了 DAC 项目高成本的商业回收难题。
impactAnalysis.technical: 强制执行基于化学示踪与压力动态的实时监测标准，验证了注入后两年内 95% 的二氧化碳转化为固态石头的技术指标，确立了全球矿化封存的技术门槛。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为全球负排放技术的实验田，确保了大气捕捉二氧化碳的永久物理隔离，为实现《巴黎协定》温控目标提供了具备物理保真度的技术路径。

en.title: Iceland Regulatory Framework for CDR & Mineralization
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Iceland is a global leader in Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDR) and basaltic mineralization, having developed a unique regulatory framework that transposes the EU CCS Directive into national law while tailoring it to the country's specific volcanic geology. The framework is pioneered by the **Carbfix** technology, which involves dissolving CO2 in water and injecting it into reactive basaltic formations, where it turns into stone within approximately two years.

In April 2025, the Environment and Energy Agency of Iceland issued Europe's first EU-compliant onshore storage permit, allowing Carbfix to sequester 106,000 tonnes annually at the Hellisheiði site. This framework supports both point-source capture from geothermal plants and high-profile Direct Air Capture (DAC) installations like Climeworks' Orca and Mammoth. As large-scale hubs like the Coda Terminal advance, Iceland’s CDR framework is establishing the global standard for 'permanent negative emissions,' providing the rigorous MMV and liability protocols needed for the mineralization pathway.

impactAnalysis.economic: By legally defining mineralization as 'permanent storage,' the framework ensures that Iceland-based CDR credits command a significant price premium in international markets, enabling project bankability for DAC developers.
impactAnalysis.technical: Enforces strict chemical tracing and reservoir pressure monitoring, validating the 95% mineralization rate within 2 years—a benchmark for high-fidelity removals.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Guarantees the absolute permanence of captured atmospheric CO2, protecting the environmental integrity of negative emission claims toward global 1.5°C goals.

implementationDetails.authority: Environment and Energy Agency of Iceland (UST)

zh.title: 欧盟二氧化碳地质封存指令 (CCS Directive)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

欧盟 CCS 指令（Directive 2009/31/EC）是欧洲碳捕集与封存法律体系的母法，确立了在欧盟境内进行二氧化碳地质封存的最高监管框架。该指令的核心目标是确保封存作业的安全性，防止对环境和人类健康产生负面影响。其最具里程碑意义的规定是建立了 **“长期责任转移”** 机制：在封存场地关闭至少 20 年后，若证明 CO2 已被永久且完全固定，运营商可将后续监测与修复责任移交给所在成员国政府。

2024-2025 年间，该指令经历了实质性的执行强化。为了对齐‘净零工业法案 (NZIA)’中 50Mtpa 的封存目标，欧盟委员会于 2024 年 7 月发布了修订后的实施指引，旨在简化成员国的许可审批流程并引入基于风险的财务担保方法。此外，该指令还通过 TEN-E 条例支持跨境 CO2 管网建设，为打造全欧洲统一的碳管理市场奠定了法制底座。尽管面临脱欧后的跨境法律障碍，该指令依然是全球 CCS 安全监管与责任划定的黄金基准。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 20 年责任移交机制，成功对冲了运营商面对‘地质尺度’长期责任的财务风险，使商业保险和融资机构能够进入封存市场。
impactAnalysis.technical: 设定了全球最高标准的储层安全性与监测准则，2024 修订版进一步引入了对新型封存监测技术的准入路径，保持了欧盟在 CCS 技术规制上的领先性。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为全欧洲封存安全的‘最后一道防线’，确保了所有进入欧盟储层的 CO2 均实现永久物理隔离，支撑了欧盟 ETS 下减排额度的权威性。

implementationDetails.mechanism: 超国家法律框架与成员国转法 (Transposition)

en.title: EU Directive on the Geological Storage of CO2 (CCS Directive)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The EU CCS Directive (Directive 2009/31/EC) is the constitutional foundation of Europe's carbon management legal system. It establishes the highest regulatory standards for the safe geological sequestration of CO2 across the EU, ensuring environmental integrity and public safety. Its most celebrated provision is the **Long-term Liability Transfer mechanism**, which allows operators to hand over monitoring and remediation responsibilities to Member State governments after a minimum of 20 years post-closure, provided storage permanence is verified.

In 2024-2025, the Directive was significantly bolstered to align with the Net-Zero Industry Act (NZIA) target of 50 Mtpa injection capacity by 2030. The Commission published updated guidance in July 2024 to streamline permitting and introduce more flexible, risk-based financial security requirements. By integrating with the TEN-E regulation for cross-border infrastructure, the Directive serves as the legal backbone for a unified European carbon management market, setting the global benchmark for CCS safety and liability management.

impactAnalysis.economic: The 20-year liability transfer solves the otherwise uninsurable tail-risk of geological storage, creating the long-term certainty required for project financing.
impactAnalysis.technical: Mandates state-of-the-art monitoring and reservoir characterization; the 2024 updates further accommodate novel monitoring technologies and sub-surface modeling.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Guarantees the absolute permanence of sequestration across the Union, underpinning the environmental credibility of the EU Emissions Trading System (ETS).

zh.title: 英国 2023 年能源法案 (CCUS 经济监管)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

《2023 能源法案》是英国历史上最重要的能源立法之一，为实现 2050 净零排放提供了核心法律框架。针对 CCUS 领域，该法案最具突破性的进展是确立了**二氧化碳运输与存储 (T&S) 的经济监管制度**。法案授权英国天然气和电力市场办公室 (Ofgem) 作为 CCUS T&S 的独立经济监管机构，模仿现有的受规制资产基础 (RAB) 模式，为管网和封存场运营商设定允许收益，确保了大规模基础设施建设的长期财务可预测性。

法案还为‘收入支持合约（Revenue Support Contracts）’确立了法定地位，支持通过差价合约 (CfD) 机制为捕集项目提供 10-15 年的财务保障。2024 年底，随着 East Coast 和 HyNet 两大集群项目相继达成财务结算 (Financial Close)，该法案的执行进入了深水区。通过这种将‘公用事业化管理’与‘财政差价补足’相结合的法律构造，英国正在建立全球最具投资吸引力的 CCUS 市场，旨在到 2030 年每年封存 2000-3000 万吨 CO2。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过引入受规制资产基础 (RAB) 模式，成功将 CCUS 基础设施转变为具备稳定收益预期的‘类公用事业’资产，极大地吸引了低成本的基础设施基金进入该领域。
impactAnalysis.technical: 驱动了北海枯竭气田大规模回注与跨行业捕集管网的技术标准化，确立了全球领先的‘集群化 (Clustering)’开发范式。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为英国 2050 气候承诺的法制基石，旨在通过大规模地质封存抵消高碳重工业的硬减排，支撑 2030 年减排目标的量化达成。

en.title: UK Energy Act 2023 (CCUS Economic Regulation)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The Energy Act 2023 is the primary legislative engine for the UK's energy transition, providing the robust legal framework needed to reach Net Zero by 2050. For the CCUS sector, it establishes a world-first **Economic Regulation model for Transport and Storage (T&S)**. The Act designates Ofgem as the independent economic regulator for CO2 networks, applying a Regulated Asset Base (RAB) model. This ensures that infrastructure operators can earn a predictable, regulated return on their investments, similar to traditional gas and electricity grids.

Furthermore, the Act formalizes the statutory basis for 'Revenue Support Contracts', enabling the government to issue long-term Contracts for Difference (CfDs) to carbon capture facilities. With the HyNet and East Coast clusters reaching Financial Close in late 2024, the Act is now being actively enforced to build out the nation’s 2030 CCUS vision. By turning high-risk infrastructure into stable, bankable utility-style assets, the UK has created one of the most attractive regulatory environments globally for carbon management capital.

impactAnalysis.economic: Dramatically lowers the WACC for T&S projects by applying the RAB model, converting infrastructure risks into predictable revenue streams attractive to institutional investors.
impactAnalysis.technical: Standardizes technical protocols for large-scale offshore sequestration and high-pressure CO2 pipelines, enabling the deployment of world-class industrial clusters.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Anchors the UK's legally binding carbon budgets, ensuring that industrial sequestration delivers physical and verifiable GHG reductions towards the 2050 goal.

zh.title: 美国 CIFIA 二氧化碳运输基础设施融资计划
zh.description:
## 政策概览

美国 CIFIA 计划（Carbon Dioxide Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation）是根据 2021 年《基础设施投资与就业法案》（IIJA）设立的旗舰级融资工具，由美国能源部贷款项目办公室 (LPO) 与化石能源与碳管理办公室 (FECM) 共同管理。该计划拨付了总计 **21 亿美元** 的专项预算，旨在通过联邦贷款、贷款担保和直接拨款，解决 CO2 运输管网建设中的高融资门槛和‘先鸡还是先蛋’的基建难题。

CIFIA 的核心特色是支持‘公共承运人 (Common Carrier)’模式，强制要求获资助的基础设施必须向第三方开放准入。2024 年底发布的‘未来增长拨款 (Future Growth Grants)’案提供了 5 亿美金的额外额度，专门用于支持那些建设容量超出当前商业合同、预留未来扩展空间的管网项目。这一机制通过低息联邦贷款（可推迟 5 年还款）和最高 80% 的增量成本资助，为美国跨州 CO2 骨干网的物理互联提供了核心资本动力，是实现美国百万吨级碳移除枢纽愿景的物流大动脉。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过提供长达 35 年的低息联邦贷款和贷款担保，CIFIA 显著降低了 CO2 管道项目的加权平均资本成本 (WACC)，解决了大规模物流基建回收期长的金融瓶颈。
impactAnalysis.technical: 显式激励‘超前设计 (Future Growth)’，推动了具备冗余容量的大口径公共管网技术标准的成熟，为未来十年美国 CCS 产业的几何倍数扩张预留了物理接口。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为美国 2050 净零战略的物理连接器，旨在构建全国性的二氧化碳运输网络，支撑工业与 DAC 枢纽实现跨州资源最优配置。

en.title: US CIFIA: Carbon Dioxide Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The CIFIA program, established under the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL), is the federal government’s primary vehicle for financing large-scale CO2 transport networks. Administered by the DOE Loan Programs Office (LPO), the program provides **$2.1 billion** in low-interest federal loans, loan guarantees, and grants. It specifically addresses the high capital risks associated with first-of-a-kind (FOAK) infrastructure, where high upfront costs often outpace early-stage capture demand.

A standout feature of CIFIA is its mandate for 'Common Carrier' status, ensuring non-discriminatory access for third-party emitters. In late 2024, the program launched the **Future Growth Grants**, offering $500 million to subsidize incremental costs for projects that build capacity in excess of current contracts. This forward-looking approach ensures that the US CO2 logistics network can scale rapidly to meet 2030 and 2050 targets, turning fragmented pipelines into a unified, bankable national carbon management infrastructure.

impactAnalysis.economic: Reduces the WACC for multi-billion dollar pipeline projects through long-term federal credit instruments, enabling private developers to reach FID on shared infrastructure.
impactAnalysis.technical: Drives the standardization of high-capacity CO2 transport, incentivizing the design of 'over-sized' systems that eliminate logistical bottlenecks for the next decade of CCS growth.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Constructs the essential physical link for the US net-zero trajectory, facilitating the transfer of CO2 from heavy industrial clusters to permanent sequestration sites across state lines.

zh.title: 美国 EPA VI 类井州级执法权委派 (Primacy)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

美国 EPA VI 类井州级执法权（Primacy）是美国 CCS 项目审批提速的核心制度工具。根据《安全饮用水法》，EPA 负责监管用于二氧化碳地质封存的 VI 类井，但允许具备条件的州政府申请自主监管权。截至 2025 年底，这一制度取得了里程碑式进展：继北达科他州和怀俄明州之后，**路易斯安那州 (2024年2月)** 和 **德克萨斯州 (2025年12月)** 相继获得执法权。

执法权委派的实质性影响在于大幅缩短审批周期。在 EPA 直接监管下，单个许可审批通常需 2 年以上；而获得 Primacy 的州（如北达科他州）成功将审批时间减半。这对于 45Q 税收抵免的合规性（要求 2032 年底前开工）至关重要。2025 年，路易斯安那州已签发 13 项许可，德州铁路委员会 (RRC) 也已全面接管原本积压在 EPA 的 30 余项申请。虽然路州在 2025 年底针对新申请实施了临时延期以优化社区参与标准，但州级执法权依然是美国打造全球 CCS 封存高地的制度保障。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过将审批周期平均缩短 50%（从 24+ 个月缩减至 12 个月左右），显著降低了 CCS 项目的前置机会成本，并确保了项目能赶在 45Q 政策窗口关闭前达成 FID。
impactAnalysis.technical: 驱动了各州建立专业的地质封存核算团队，推动了州级地下水实时监控系统与联邦 EPA 标准的深度技术互认。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 在权力下放的同时，通过联邦 40 CFR Part 145 法规保持了对饮用水水源保护的最高环保红线，确保了行政提速不以牺牲长期封存安全性为代价。

en.title: US EPA Class VI Primacy Delegation
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Class VI Primacy is the most critical regulatory mechanism for accelerating the development of the US CCS market. Under the Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA), the EPA is responsible for overseeing the injection of CO2 into Class VI wells but allows qualified states to assume primary enforcement authority. As of late 2025, the program achieved massive scale with **Louisiana (Feb 2024)** and **Texas (Dec 2025)** joining North Dakota and Wyoming as primacy states.

The real-world impact of primacy is the drastic reduction in permitting timelines. While federal reviews often exceed 24 months, primacy states have demonstrated the ability to cut approval times in half. This acceleration is essential for project bankability under the 45Q tax credit, which requires construction to commence by the end of 2032. With Texas alone managing over 30 pending applications at the time of transfer, state-led primacy provides the administrative bandwidth necessary to scale the US from demonstration projects to a unified national sequestration infrastructure.

impactAnalysis.economic: By cutting administrative delays by 50%, primacy protects billions in 45Q tax assets from expiration and lowers pre-FID development interest expenses for major hubs.
impactAnalysis.technical: Propels state-level geological expertise and ensures high-fidelity integration between state sub-surface databases and the federal EPA GGRDW reporting system.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Ensures that administrative speed does not compromise safety, as states must maintain regulatory stringency at or above the federal SDWA baseline for drinking water protection.

zh.title: 萨斯喀彻温省石油创新激励计划 (SPII)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

萨斯喀彻温省石油创新激励计划 (SPII) 是加拿大最具代表性的省级能源创新支持工具之一。该计划旨在通过提供可转让的**皇室使用费 (Royalty)** 和 **生产税抵免**，鼓励油气行业的技术商业化，其中包括碳捕集与封存（CCS）技术的集成应用。SPII 的核心激励强度高达 **25% 的符合条件项目成本**，涵盖了从试点规模到商业化部署的全阶段。

2024-2025 年间，该政策与萨斯喀彻温省技术基金（Saskatchewan Technology Fund）形成了深度联动。截至 2025 年 10 月，技术基金已拨付 4750 万加元支持包括 Federated Co-Operatives 乙醇厂 Bio-CCS 在内的 9 个工业项目。SPII 的独特之处在于其‘可转让性’，允许不直接产生盈利的早期 CCS 项目通过向其他生产商出售抵免额度来提前变现。这一灵活性使萨省成功吸引了超过 6 亿加元的私人投资，支撑了如 Whitecap Resources 领衔的年捕集能力达 420 万吨的东南萨省 CCS 枢纽建设。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 25% 的可转让税收抵免，显著降低了 CCS 创新项目的初期资本回收压力，并通过允许额度买卖为非盈利性试点提供了关键的现金流补充。
impactAnalysis.technical: 显式支持油气加工过程中的副产品资源化与环境影响管理，推动了萨省在 Bio-CCS 与重油资产脱碳领域的技术标准化。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为萨省 2030 增长计划的财政支撑，旨在通过加速低碳技术落地实现工业与能源领域的物理减排，每年带动数百万吨的碳封存潜力。

en.title: Saskatchewan Petroleum Innovation Incentive (SPII)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

The Saskatchewan Petroleum Innovation Incentive (SPII) is one of Canada's most effective sub-national tools for accelerating energy technology commercialization. The program offers **transferable Crown royalty and freehold production tax credits equal to 25% of eligible project costs** for qualified innovations, including Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS). SPII covers both pilot and commercial-scale deployments, providing a flexible financial bridge for high-risk ventures.

In 2024 and 2025, SPII has been tightly integrated with the Saskatchewan Technology Fund, which recently allocated $47.5M to nine flagship projects, including Federated Co-Operatives' Bio-CCS complex. A key strength of the policy is the transferability of credits, allowing developers who are not yet profitable to monetize their tax benefits by selling them to established producers. This mechanism has successfully mobilized over $600M in private investment, anchoring major infrastructure developments like the 4.2 Mtpa Southeast Saskatchewan CCUS Hub.

impactAnalysis.technical: Focuses on byproduct management and value-added processing in the oil sands region, driving technical maturity in Bio-CCS and cold-climate sequestration operations.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Anchors Saskatchewan’s role in Canada's 2030 ERP, enabling millions of tonnes of industrial CO2 storage while maintaining the competitiveness of heavy energy assets.

zh.title: 生态环境部 CCUS 项目环境监管指引 (2024 更新版)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

中国生态环境部 (MEE) 在 2024 年显著强化了对 CCUS 项目的环境监管颗粒度。该指引是在‘十三五’期间发布的《环境风险评估技术指南（试行）》基础上，结合 2024 年《中国 CCUS 年度报告》及最新的环评试点工作进行的系统性升级。其核心使命是确立 CCUS 全生命周期的‘环境底线’，要求所有在建和拟建项目必须进行统筹污染物与碳排放的协同环评（Synergistic EIA）。

2024 版指引明确了针对 CO2 捕集、液化、运输及封存环节的具体环境风险识别指标，特别是针对深层地质封存可能带来的地下水污染、地表沉降及生态破坏风险设定了强制性的监测预警线。该政策标志着中国 CCUS 监管从单纯的‘技术鼓励’转向‘安全合规与减污降碳协同’的双重约束模式。通过强制推行项目环境风险分级管理，该指引为 CCUS 产业从工程示范向规范化、规模化发展提供了制度化的环保锚点。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过设定明确的环保红线，虽然短期内提升了项目的合规投入成本，但通过‘减污降碳协同’机制为项目争取了更多的绿色金融授信与行政审批红利。
impactAnalysis.technical: 倒逼了高精度泄漏监测设备与储层稳定性地化模拟技术在国产 CCUS 设施中的集成，确立了中国 CCUS 环境安全监测的技术标准。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为中国 CCUS 发展的‘绿色屏障’，确保了大规模地质封存作业不会对地下水系统及周边生态产生不可逆影响，维护了碳中和的技术诚信。

en.title: China MEE Guidance on CCUS Environmental Oversight (2024 Update)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

In 2024, China's Ministry of Ecology and Environment (MEE) significantly refined its regulatory oversight for CCUS projects. Building upon the 2016 trial guidelines and integrated with the 2024 China CCUS Annual Report, this updated guidance establishes the 'environmental redlines' for the entire value chain. A key feature is the mandate for 'Synergistic Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA)', which requires projects to evaluate conventional pollutants and carbon emissions concurrently.

The 2024 update provides detailed risk identification metrics for CO2 capture, liquefaction, transport, and sequestration. It specifically targets potential risks such as groundwater contamination, land subsidence, and induced seismicity, setting mandatory early-warning thresholds. This policy marks a transition in China's CCUS governance from pure technological encouragement to a dual-constraint model emphasizing safety, compliance, and multi-pollutant reduction. By implementing graded risk management, the guidance provides the institutional framework necessary for CCUS to scale from isolated engineering demos to standardized national infrastructure.

impactAnalysis.technical: Enforces the adoption of high-precision leakage sensors and geochemical reservoir modeling, standardizing environmental safety technologies within the domestic supply chain.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Guarantees the long-term integrity of geological storage in China, ensuring that sequestration activities do not compromise the safety of water resources or local biodiversity.

zh.title: 越南第 119/2025 号政令 - 温室气体与碳管理框架
zh.description: 越南政府于 2025 年 6 月发布第 119/2025/ND-CP 号政令，系统性地建立了国家温室气体配额与信用管理体系。该政令确立了越南首个**国家注册登记系统**，并明确了针对火电、钢铁和水泥行业的强制性配额分配方案（2025-2026 试点期）。对于 CCUS 领域，政令首次从法律上承认了 CCS 项目产生的减排量可用于履行国家配额义务，并授权自然资源与环境部制定详尽的核证与监测标准。这一法案是越南对接全球气候投融资、建立本国碳市场的制度核心。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过将 CCUS 纳入碳市场抵消体系，为越南境内项目提供了市场化溢价可能，吸引了跨国能源巨头在越南沿海布局碳枢纽。
impactAnalysis.technical: 强制推行国家级的 GHG 监测与核报标准，提升了越南重工业数据的透明度，确立了 CCS 技术的核算合法性。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为越南实现 2050 净零承诺的关键法律依据，确保了工业部门的减排活动处于严密的行政监管之下，防止虚假核证。

mrv.label: 强制性配额审计

strategic.label: 对接全球市场

en.title: Vietnam Decree 119/2025: GHG & Carbon Management
en.description: Issued in June 2025, Decree No. 119/2025/ND-CP is the primary executive order governing Vietnam's transition to a structured carbon economy. It establishes the **National Registration System** for GHG quotas and credits and mandates an emission allowance pilot for the power, steel, and cement sectors during 2025-2026. For the CCUS sector, the Decree provides the first legal recognition of sequestration outcomes as tradeable offsets within the domestic system. By delegating methodology development to MONRE, the framework provides the institutional certainty required for international investors to leverage Vietnam’s offshore sequestration potential as part of the regional low-carbon supply chain.

impactAnalysis.economic: Creates a market-based valuation for CCS outcomes in Southeast Asia, enabling project developers to monetize carbon credits through the emerging national ETS.
impactAnalysis.technical: Enforces standardized GHG accounting and sub-surface monitoring requirements, elevating industrial data transparency to international audit standards.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Anchors Vietnam's COP26 net-zero pledge in a rigorous legal framework, ensuring that industrial sequestration delivers verifiable and permanent GHG reductions.

zh.title: 巴西“未来燃料”法案 (Law 14,993/2024)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

巴西第 14,993/2024 号法律（Law on Fuels of the Future）于 2024 年 10 月 8 日签署成法，确立了南美洲首个针对碳捕集与封存（CCS）的专门法律框架。该法案的核心在于通过 30 年期的特许经营权制度规范二氧化碳的地质封存，并指定巴西国家石油、天然气和生物燃料管理局 (ANP) 作为中央监管机构。

该法律将 CCS 与巴西庞大的生物燃料产业（特别是生物乙醇）深度整合。通过确立 CCS 产生的碳减排额度可用于履行全国受规管碳市场 (SBCE) 的义务，并为可持续航空燃料 (SAF) 设定了强制混合配额，为生物质碳捕集与封存 (BECCS) 提供了稳健的商业化路径。此外，法律明确排除了 CO2-EOR（提高石油采收率）路径在纯 CCS 授权下的适用性，确保了技术资金流向永久性地质隔离，标志着巴西从资源依赖型增长向低碳管理枢纽的战略转向。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过 30 年期的 CCS 特许经营权制度和 SAF（可持续航空燃料）强制混合配额，为巴西庞大的生物乙醇捕集项目提供了稳健的市场化现金流。
impactAnalysis.technical: 法律显式排除了 CO2-EOR 路径在纯 CCS 框架下的适用性，引导技术资金流向纯地质封存，提升了减排的长期环境保真度。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为巴西能源转型的法律基石，支撑航空业到 2037 年实现 10% 的 SAF 使用率，并加速大规模负排放路径的成熟。

zh.title: 沙特阿拉伯氢能战略与 CCS 耦合计划 (2024)
zh.description: 沙特阿拉伯将其氢能战略与 CCS 技术进行了深度绑定，作为实现其‘循环碳经济’愿景的核心。沙特阿美 (Saudi Aramco) 已宣布将其 2024-2026 年资本开支的 **10%** 专门投向包括 CCS 在内的新能源领域。战略重点是生产‘蓝氢’，即通过 CCUS 技术消除天然气制氢过程中的排放。沙特绿色倡议 (SGI) 设定了到 2030 年每年减排 2.78 亿吨的目标，其中 CCS 枢纽建设被视为实现该目标的物理引擎。通过大规模低成本封存，沙特旨在确立其作为全球低碳能源出口国的绝对竞争力。

zh.title: 《巴黎协定》第 6.4 条碳交易机制 (含 CCS/CDR 标准)
zh.description:
## 政策概览

《巴黎协定》第 6.4 条旨在建立一个由联合国直接监管的全球碳减排机制（A6.4ERs），允许各国通过高质量的减排项目进行碳信用交易。2024 年 10 月，第 6.4 条监管机构（Supervisory Body）正式通过了针对**碳移除（Carbon Removals）**和方法学的关键标准，并于 COP29 期间正式生效。这标志着基于 CCS 和直接空气捕集（DAC）等技术手段实现的物理减排量，正式获得了进入国际主权碳市场的‘入场券’。

该机制的核心是确立了严苛的‘逆转标准（Reversal Standard）’和风险减缓措施，通过建立全球碳汇缓冲池（Buffer Pool）来对冲因火灾、泄露等不可抗力导致的碳减排失效风险。对于 CCS 项目，该机制规定了长达 **15 年** 的初始计入期（可续展两次），并强制要求执行‘相应调整（Corresponding Adjustments）’以彻底消除双重计算。这一全球统一的市场准则，将极大地促进跨国封存枢纽的商业化，为‘全球南方’国家的低碳基础设施通过国际资本市场融资提供了制度保障。

impactAnalysis.economic: 通过‘相应调整’机制消除了双重计算风险，确立了 A6.4ERs 作为主权级高溢价资产的地位，为跨国封存项目吸引了极大规模的合规碳市场资金。
impactAnalysis.technical: 2024 年生效的 CDR 指引强制要求执行基于风险的储层稳定性评估与长效监测，确立了全球范围内地质封存项目‘逆转风险’的计价基准。
impactAnalysis.environmental: 作为全球减排诚信度的‘最高法院’，确保了 CCS 产生的碳移除量在国际转移过程中保持 100% 的环境保真度。

en.title: Paris Agreement Article 6.4 Mechanism (CCS & CDR Standards)
en.description:
## Policy Overview

Article 6.4 of the Paris Agreement establishes a United Nations-led global carbon market mechanism (A6.4ERs), enabling parties to trade high-integrity emission reductions and removals. In October 2024, the Article 6.4 Supervisory Body (SBM) finalized and adopted groundbreaking standards for **Carbon Removals**, which became effective during COP29. This formalizes the path for CCS and Direct Air Capture (DAC) projects to generate internationally recognized carbon credits eligible for use in national NDCs.

Key to this mechanism is the introduction of a rigorous **Reversal Standard**, requiring projects to mitigate risks such as storage leakage or physical loss through a centralized Global Buffer Pool. For CCS, the rules mandate a 15-year crediting period (renewable twice) and enforce 'Corresponding Adjustments' to eliminate double-counting. By providing a unified, sovereign-level market framework, Article 6.4 unlocks large-scale international financing for carbon management infrastructure, particularly in emerging economies, by ensuring the environmental and legal integrity of every tonne sequestered.

impactAnalysis.economic: Eliminates methodological risks through 'Corresponding Adjustments,' making A6.4ERs a premium asset class for sovereign buyers and significantly lowering the cost of capital for cross-border Hubs.
impactAnalysis.technical: The 2024 CDR guidelines enforce risk-based sub-surface characterization and long-term monitoring, standardizing the 'reversal' accounting logic globally.
impactAnalysis.environmental: Acts as the global guarantor of environmental integrity for sequestered CO2, ensuring that international transfers result in real, additional, and permanent removals.

implementationDetails.mechanism: International Mitigation Outcomes (A6.4ERs) & Global Buffer Pool
implementationDetails.fundingScale: Sovereign-driven market-based finance impacting multi-billion USD flows

market.evidence: Establishes the only UN-regulated global baseline for high-fidelity carbon assets linked to national NDCs.
